Executive Planning Officer

Company Name Department of Planning and Environment Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 23 hours ago Number of views 19 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Title: Executive Planning Officer- Office of the Executive Director Strategic Planning + Programs ,Planning + Design Division
Job Grade / Classification: Planning Officer -PO3
Employment Status: Ongoing - Full Time
  • Exciting Opportunity
  • Sydney Location - (Relocating to Parramatta at the end of 2019)
  • Rewarding Salary
Agency Overview

The Department of Planning & Environment (DPE) is the lead NSW Government agency in planning for a growing NSW. The Department is going through an exciting period of organisational and operational change.

The Department’s vision – Planning for growing NSW: inspiring strong communities, protecting our environment – provides the benchmark for our partnership and leadership approach to engaging and working collaboratively with key State and Local Government, community and industry stakeholders to deliver better outcomes in the areas of planning, local government and the environment. Please click here for more information about DPE

Primary Purpose Of The Role

Planning + Design Division is seeking an Executive Planning Officer who has the ability to provide specialist planning advice and support services to assist achieving strategic and operational goals in line with the Divisional, Departmental and Government objectives. The Executive Planning Officer reports directly to the Executive Director Strategic Planning + Programs and will operate in a diverse working environment to:
  • Provide executive planning support to the Executive Director to enable robust, fair and timely decision-making
  • Coordinate, prepare, review and edit technical briefings and reports, House Folder Notes, Parliamentary questions, Budget Estimates Committee information, Cabinet Minutes and submissions, all for the consideration of the Executive Director
  • Oversee efficient correspondence flow and coordinate and prepare timely and accurate information and reports for a diverse range of stakeholders on management, policy, program and service delivery
  • Provide support for developing and reporting on Department business plan objectives and divisional goals, measures and deliverables; coordinate and prepare the Division’s input to the Department’s Annual Report; and report to, and on behalf of, the Executive Director on State and Premier’s priorities
  • Maintain effective working partnerships and relationships with Department officers within and outside the Division to coordinate, collaborate on, and prepare whole-of-Department advice on key complex and controversial planning matters; convene, participate in and provide secretariat support to divisional and inter-divisional meetings and workshops; and support the achievement of the Department’s business plan goals and objectives
  • Prepare and coordinate research and analysis, distil and synthesise key issues in a pragmatic manner, and consolidate recommendations and responses on diverse and complex policy, technical planning and operational matters to support best practice planning and assessment processes and Executive, Departmental and Ministerial decision-making
You must read the following documents prior to preparing your application:

Role Description

 Application Guide

Applying for a role in the NSW Public Sector

Essential Requirements
  • Degree qualification in planning or a related discipline
  • Relevant experience working within a planning environment at a more senior level
  • Practical knowledge of the working of government and its processes
Job Notes

A Recruitment Pool will be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12 month period.

To Apply
  • Attach your resume that sets out your education, work history and other facts about yourself that relate to the role (maximum of 4 pages);
  • Attach a cover letter that is relevant to the role (maximum of 1 page).
The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.)

Our Commitment To Diversity

The Department of Planning and Environment values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse groups and those with a disability.

You can also follow us on DPE LinkedIn and #LifeAtDPE on LinkedIn

Applications Close: 30/09/2018

Job description

About the Role

The Senior International Engagement Manager – Trade and Development, is primarily responsible for managing Standards Australia’s international trade and aid-for-trade (AFT) related standards activities and relationships.

The International Engagement Team is responsible for managing and promoting Standards Australia’s international roles, relationships and activities.


Key Responsibilities

  • Foreign, Trade and Aid Policy – Insight; Submissions and Opportunities
  • Trade and Aid Organisations - Relationship Management Foreign, Trade and Aid Projects - Development and Delivery
  • International Engagement – Strategy and Communication
  • International Engagement – People Management
  • International Engagement – Business Transformation and Process Improvement
  • International Engagement – Collaboration Across Portfolios


What are we looking for?

  • Undergraduate or graduate degree in politics, international relations, communication or other relevant field
  • Proven experience in a professional, government, commercial or similar international policy role
  • Extensive understanding of Australia’s trade policy and economic diplomacy priorities, preferably in the Indo-Pacific region
  • Advocacy, negotiation and communication capabilities are core competencies
  • Cultural awareness, sensitivity and ability to work and communicate effectively and diplomatically across many different language and cultural groups
  • The role demands resilience, initiative, strong written and oral communication skills and an understanding of policy development and the mechanics of government


Working for Standards Australia

Integrity, Courage, Accountability, Respect and Excellence form the basis of all we do. We offer a challenging and positive environment where individual and team efforts are recognised and rewarded. We invest in the health and welfare of our people offering access to an Employee Assistance Program, Salary Packaging, yearly flu vaccinations and regular social events. We are committed to a workplace which supports equal employment opportunities.


What now?

If this sounds like an environment that will bring out the best in you, please submit your covering letter and resume. Eligible applicants must be a Permanent Resident or have legal rights to work in Australia.

Laboratory Chemistry Analyst

Company Name George Weston Foods Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 138 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

An exciting opportunity for an experienced Laboratory Chemistry Analyst is currently available in our AB Mauri team, based at North Ryde. You will enjoy delivering analytical testing services for the Scientific Services Department and support the chemistry team leader in the delivery of a comprehensive Analytical Technical Service to AB Mauri Global Technology Group and its global operational customer base.


This role will see you involved in the chemical analysis of yeast, yeast fermentation biproducts and yeast process related samples is executed a variety of techniques covering wet chemistry, HPLC, GC, instrumental protein and NIR analysis and you will conduct regular preparation and evaluation of standard powders and solutions, including solution stability measurements.

In addition, you will ensure validation of methods carried out are using set protocols and ensure results are analysed, interpreted and reports are prepared as required in a clear and concise manner which draw on conclusions for non-specialists.


About you


The ideal candidate will have proven experience in industrial chemistry, HPLC experience, exposure to Analytical Standards management, strong task management and teamwork skills and high attention to detail and a minimum of 3 years’ experience working in a similar capacity.

In addition, you will have superior communication skills, strong computer skills, yeast and fermentation chemistry experience and ideally tertiary qualifications such as a Bachelor of Science.


About the Benefits


We are a business that offers excellent career pathways and ongoing development and training. You will enjoy working with a great team of technical experts and genuinely make a big impact in this newly created role. \xa0

Best of all it’s a great place to work and you’ll have the ability to work with like-minded Technical professionals such as yourself! We are a company that also offers genuine career pathways and development opportunities in future.

Junior Media Role: Commercial Inventory Co-ordinator

Company Name Multi Channel Network Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 89 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

MCN currently has a vacancy for a 6 month contract role for a Commercial Inventory Co-ordinator\xa0within the C.I Department in the Sydney Office. We are looking for a career driven individual who has a genuine interest in media & advertising and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. This is a fantastic opportunity to put your organisational skills, problem solving ability and attention to detail to good use!


Commercial Inventory is the department that looks after all sold advertisements across MCN's broadcasted TV channels. We work closely with both our sales teams & brand and partnerships teams to ensure that campaigns are delivered and sponsorships exclusivity requirements are met. We maintain strong channel relationships for MCN represented channels across a number of local and International regions. We are also the main point of contact with advertising agencies to ensure spots are aired in accordance to their campaign creative deliverables.


As a Commercial Inventory Co-ordinator, the key responsibilities of the role are;\xa0

  • Create strong relationships with MCN's local & international channel partners
  • Liaise & work with Advertising Agencies across Australia
  • Close working relationship between both our sales and our brand and partnership departments
  • Placement & allocation of sponsorships across our key programs
  • Review all commercial content to comply with individual channel policies
  • Securing all late revenue with available inventory
  • Ensuring all TV schedules are finalised & ready for broadcast for both our Foxtel and Network Ten channels
  • Ensure that all TV schedules are delivered to the channels by our imposed deadlines
  • Reconciliation of all TV schedules, ensuring all spots were transmitted correctly before billing


This is a highly\xa0administrative role and the right candidate would ideally possess the below skills;

  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to meet daily deadlines across a number of broadcast regions.
  • Aptitude in multi-tasking
  • Thrive in a fast paced deadline driven environment.
  • Portray excellent communication skills
  • Work well within a team environment


What We Offer:\xa0A dynamic and challenging environment, MCN is constantly on the move – generating innovative ideas and delivering successful campaigns. At MCN, we pride ourselves on fostering a social, relaxed and fresh atmosphere with great career progression and encouragement in personal development.

Placement Support Officer

Company Name Macquarie University Company Location University Avenue Macquarie University, Sydney, NSW 2109, AU

New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 48 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Salary Package: $70,699 to $80,381 p.a. (HEW Level 5)
  • Appointment Type: Full-time, Fixed term until November 2019
  • Macquarie University (North Ryde) location

The Role

We are seeking a Placement Support Officer to join the Faulty of Medicine and Health Sciences in October 2018 for a fixed-term role to provide parental leave coverage. The incumbent will administer placements across a number of educational programs and provide support to students and partners to ensure they run smoothly. This will involve:

  • Ensuring students meet the requirements of their placement program prior to commencement, including reporting on compliance requirements.
  • Contributing to the facilitation of pre-commencement placement training sessions for students.
  • Providing administrative support for student placements such as maintaining systems, monitoring student progress, gathering information for reporting and collecting feedback.
  • Assisting with the recruitment of volunteers and general student placement support enquiries.

About You

You will be an engaged and motivated individual, ideally with experience from a similar role or an area that offers student placements. You will show initiative and know how to prioritise work and will have excellent interpersonal and communication skills with an ability to navigate through a novel mode of placement delivery with enthusiasm, resilience and flexibility to adapt if challenges arise.

About Us

Join a Faculty that is part of nation’s first fully integrated academic health sciences centre. We are a research active Faculty with research interests in biomedical, translational and health services domains. In learning and teaching, the Faculty offers a unique suite of capability-based medical education programs including a unique three-year extended masters-level, professional-entry Doctor of Physiotherapy degree, a Graduate Diploma of Anatomy program, a Master of Public Health, an accelerated 2 year Bachelor of Clinical Science program and the Macquarie MD (Doctor of Medicine).

Macquarie is a university engaged with the real and often complex problems and opportunities that define our lives. Since our foundation 54 years ago, we have aspired to be a different type of university. Over the years, we’ve grown to become the centre of a vibrant local and global community. Connect with us today.

To Apply

To be considered for this position, the applicant will demonstrate the below requirements in their CV and a 1 - 2 page cover letter:

  • Demonstrated experience working in both administrative and customer service environments (preferably in placement management and/or volunteer program management).
  • Demonstrated interpersonal skills with proven ability to liaise effectively at all levels with a diverse range of stakeholders.
  • Excellent attention to detail and strong organisational skills with the proven ability to effectively prioritise workload to meet deadlines.
  • Ability to exercise initiative and work both independently and as part of a team.
  • Demonstrated experience in working with complex information management and/or administration systems.

For further information regarding this role and to view the position description, please visit;
http://jobs.mq.edu.au/cw/en/job/504562/placement-support-officer


Enquiries: Tania Kinane, Student Services Manager at tania.kinane@mq.edu.au


Applications Close: Sunday, 23 September 2018 at 11:55pm (AEST)


Note: This position requires a criminal record check.


Macquarie University is committed to Equity, Diversity and Inclusion. We value individual difference and recognise the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where the backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of our staff are a driving force for collaboration, innovation and impact.


We work to ensure genuine equality of opportunity for people regardless of their gender, age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and/or family status, and we encourage you to apply for a position at Macquarie University.

Customer Care Quality Manager

Company Name volt bank Company Location 41 McLaren St, North Sydney, NSW 2060, AU

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

volt is a Sydney based fintech start-up creating differentiated financial solutions all in the best interest of our customers. Our aim is to help our customers to manage their money better and achieve their financial goals, seamlessly.


We are building an organisation that is going to shake-up the financial services sector with world class technology, products and processes. To deliver this we are building a team of highly talented and relentlessly driven people who are focused on driving innovative customer outcomes.


About the Role:

We are looking for a Customer Care Quality Manager who is highly experienced, passionate and energetic about providing exceptional operational excellence and taking the next step in their leadership career.

To be successful you must understand business operations and bring together cross-functional workflows to consistently achieve customer, productivity and strategic objectives. You must have a genuine passion for assisting customers in achieving their financial goals, it is essential as it will be your key to our organisational agility as you lead teams through the growth and change.


Expertise:

  • A customer centric focus.
  • Strong management experience – a broad knowledge base of general business & operational management.
  • Ability to interpret external environments and use your significant management skills in a major customer relationship.
  • Recognition of company culture, organisational constraints and standard marketplace pressures.
  • Experience in developing policy & process to meet organisational goals/needs.
  • Familiarity with process & system automation transformation.


\xa0 Key Responsibilities:

  • Business process improvement including identifying further opportunities for automation.
  • Define and communicate processes and procedures that support the business and technology delivery through formal and/or informal training
  • Manage operations for all deposit products
  • Manage system defects, system upgrades and product enhancements by: lodging and tracking defects, assisting with developing business requirements for product enhancements, assisting with projects for new products or system upgrades, assisting with and participating in user acceptance testing for system changes and ensuring card and payment operational processes are continually kept up to date
  • Contribution to the formulation of business unit strategy.
  • Preparing policy to help deliver on strategy and vision.
  • Complex customer resolutions, capacity planning, and learning design & delivery gaps.
  • Consult proactively with key stakeholders to ensure that objectives, plans and KRIs are comprehensive, coordinated and appropriately prioritised.
  • Produce data-driven performance insights for business improvement


To successfully perform the job, you must demonstrate the following competencies:

  • Strong negotiation skills
  • A continuous improvement mindset
  • Being able to think more broadly than the task at hand
  • Excellent Problem-Solving abilities
  • A positive and resilient outlook
  • The ability to think quickly
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • A strong work ethic
  • Strong attention to detail
  • A "Can Do" attitude
  • Mental agility to adapt and thrive in a fast paced and changing environment
  • Having a growth mindset


Education:\xa0

  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field of expertise
  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment


Experience:

  • 5+ years working in an operational environment
  • Financial services experience preferred but not essential
  • Engaging with customers face to face, or over digital mediums


This is an amazing opportunity for someone who wants to join a greenfield environment and help shape the technical operations of our business.


volters move fast, collaborate and we are straight shooting. We are a start-up, but we are serious about the future. In addition to having a good time, we are also backed by sophisticated investors and a team of highly experienced industry experts.


If you’d like to find out more about who we are and the role, please apply with you CV attached.
